gameframework.motion

Class MoveStrategyConfigurableKeyboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.KeyAdapter
      • gameframework.motion.MoveStrategyConfigurableKeyboard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MoveStrategy, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MoveStrategyKeyboard

    public class MoveStrategyConfigurableKeyboard
extends java.awt.event.KeyAdapter
implements MoveStrategy
    MoveStrategy which listens to the keyboard and answers new speed vectors based on what the user typed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MoveStrategyConfigurableKeyboard

        public MoveStrategyConfigurableKeyboard()

      • MoveStrategyConfigurableKeyboard

        public MoveStrategyConfigurableKeyboard(java.lang.Boolean alwaysMove)
        Parameters:
        alwaysMove - is a boolean value that decides if a player moves continually or not. (so even if the keys are released, the object will still move in the last direction he was) (True by default)

      • MoveStrategyConfigurableKeyboard

        public MoveStrategyConfigurableKeyboard(SpeedVector speedVector)
        Parameters:
        speedVector - is a given custom speedVector for the strategy.

      • MoveStrategyConfigurableKeyboard

        public MoveStrategyConfigurableKeyboard(java.lang.Boolean alwaysMove,
                                        SpeedVector speedVector)
        Parameters:
        alwaysMove - is a boolean value that decides if a player moves continually or not. (so even if the keys are released, the object will still move in the last direction he was) (True by default)
        speedVector - is a given custom speedVector for the strategy.

      • MoveStrategyConfigurableKeyboard

        public MoveStrategyConfigurableKeyboard(java.lang.Boolean alwaysMove,
                                        SpeedVector speedVector,
                                        java.lang.Boolean combineDirections)
        Parameters:
        alwaysMove - is a boolean value that decides if a player moves continually or not. (so even if the keys are released, the object will still move in the last direction he was) (True by default)
        speedVector - is a given custom speedVector for the strategy.
        combineDirections - is a boolean value that decides if directions are combined (so if this is true and the player press the key for direction (0, -1) and the key for (1, 0) then this will result in moving in the direction (1, -1))

        direction - The direction used when the key is pressed
